intro: Bomarea subtriflora, commonly known as the Three-flowered Bomarea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in cloud forests. Its leaves are alternate, lanceolate, and have a glossy texture. The flowers, which are usually pink or purple, bloom in clusters and are pollinated by insects.
